      <schema>http://ltsc.ieee.org/xsd/LOM</schema>
      <lom xsi:schemaLocation="http://ltsc.ieee.org/xsd/LOM       http://ltsc.ieee.org/xsd/lomv1.0/lomLoose.xsd" xmlns="http://ltsc.ieee.org/xsd/LOM">
        <general>
          <identifier>
            <catalog>oai</catalog>
            <entry>oai:openlearn.open.ac.uk:SD226_2</entry>
          </identifier>
          <identifier>
            <catalog>LearningSpace</catalog>
            <entry>SD226_2</entry>
          </identifier>
          <title>
            <string language="en-gb">From sound to meaning: hearing, speech and language</string>
            <string language="x-mt-de">Von Ton zu Bedeutung: Hörfähigkeit, Rede 
und Sprache</string>
            <string language="x-mt-fr">Du bruit à la signification : audition, 
parole et langage</string>
            <string language="x-mt-pt">Do som ao meaning: hearing, discurso e 
língua</string>
            <string language="x-mt-it">Dal suono al significato: udienza, discorso 
e linguaggio</string>
            <string language="x-mt-el">Από τον ήχο στη σημασία: ακρόαση, ομιλία και 
γλώσσα</string>
            <string language="x-mt-es">De sonido al significado: audiencia, 
discurso y lenguaje</string>
          </title>
          <language>en-gb</language>
          <description>
            <string language="en-gb">Human communication is vastly more complex than that of any other species we know about. It is so complex that linguists are only just beginning to identify the processes in the brain that are related to understanding language. This unit looks at how language is understood by taking an interdisciplinary approach.</string>
          </description>
          <keyword>
            <string language="en-gb">Science and Nature</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="en-gb">aphasia</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="en-gb">Brain</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="en-gb">brain_imaging</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="en-gb">Communication</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="en-gb">electrophysiology</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="en-gb">Hearing</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="en-gb">Language</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="en-gb">Linguistics</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="en-gb">neurobiology</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="en-gb">Perception</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="en-gb">phonemes</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="en-gb">Psychology</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="en-gb">sound</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="en-gb">spectrogram</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="en-gb">syntax</string>
          </keyword>
          <structure>
            <source>structureValues</source>
            <value>linear</value>
          </structure>
          <aggregationLevel>
            <source>aggregationLevelValues</source>
            <value>2</value>
          </aggregationLevel>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-de">Menschliche Kommunikation ist in beträchtlichem 
Ausmaß komplizierter als die irgendeiner anderen Sorte, die wir 
ungefähr kennen. Es ist so kompliziert, daß Linguisten nur der
gerechte Anfang sind, zum der Prozesse im Gehirn zu kennzeichnen, die 
mit verstehender Sprache zusammenhängen. Diese Maßeinheit 
betrachtet, wie Sprache verstanden wird, indem man eine 
interdisziplinäre Annäherung nimmt.</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-fr">La transmission humaine est énormément plus 
complexe que celle de toutes les autres espèces que nous savons 
. Il est si complexe que les linguistes soient seulement début 
juste pour identifier les processus dans le cerveau qui sont liés au 
langage d'arrangement. Cette unité regarde comment le langage 
est compris en adoptant une approche interdisciplinaire.</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-pt">Uma comunicação humana é vastamente mais 
complexa do que aquela de qualquer outra espécie que nós soubermos 
aproximadamente. É assim complexo que os lingüistas são 
somente começo justo para identificar os processos no cérebro que 
são relacionados à língua compreensiva. Esta unidade olha 
como a língua é compreendida fazendo exame de uma aproximação 
interdisciplinary.</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-it">La comunicazione umana è notevolmente più 
complessa di quella di qualunque altra specie che conosciamo circa. 
È così complesso che i linguisti sono soltanto inizio giusto 
per identificare i processi nel cervello che sono collegati con il 
linguaggio capente. Questa unità guarda come il linguaggio è 
capito adottando un metodo interdisciplinare.</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-el">Η ανθρώπινη επικοινωνία είναι απέραντα πιό σύνθετη 
από αυτή οποιωνδήποτε άλλωνδήποτε ειδών που ξέρουμε περίπου. 
Είναι τόσο σύνθετο που οι γλωσσολόγοι μόνο ακριβώς 
αρχίζουν να προσδιορίζουν τις διαδικασίες στον εγκέφαλο που 
συσχετίζονται με την κατανόηση της γλώσσας. Αυτή η μονάδα 
εξετάζει το πώς η γλώσσα γίνεται κατανοητή με να υιοθετήσει μια 
διεπιστημονική μέθοδο.</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-es">La comunicación humana es sumamente más compleja
que la de cualquier otra especie que sepamos alrededor. Es tan 
complejo que los lingüistas son solamente principio justo para 
identificar los procesos en el cerebro que se relacionan con el 
lenguaje que entiende. Esta unidad mira cómo el lenguaje es 
entendido tomando un acercamiento interdisciplinario.</string>
          </description>
